snippet: The tally, announced on Monday by the lawyer Kenneth Feinberg, is higher than the 13 fatalities the automaker has linked to a defective ignition system.
abstract: Kenneth R Feinberg, lawyer running compensation program for General Motors, finds 19 death claims eligible for payment, up from company's previous assessment of 13 fatalities linked to ignition switch defect; with more than 100 death claims still under review--and more likely to be filed before Dec 31 deadline--total of claims eligible for payment is almost certain to grow.
lead_paragraph: The tally, announced on Monday by the lawyer Kenneth Feinberg, is higher than the 13 fatalities the automaker has linked to a defective ignition system.

headline.main: General Motors Defect Now Faulted in 19 Deaths
headline.print_headline: G.M. Defect Now Faulted in 19 Deaths
